sources.title: The King of Kings (1927) CECIL B. DeMILLEüçï ORIGINAL ORCHESTRAL SCORE
sources.description:
PizzaFLIX Presents CLASSIC MOVIE MONDAY
Director: Cecil B. DeMille
Stars: H.B. Warner, Jacqueline Logan, Dorothy Cumming
üçïOriginal Orchestra Score by Hugo Riesenfeldüçï
In 1927, working with one of the biggest budgets in Hollywood history and a cast & crew of over 5,000, Cecil B. DeMille brought the life and passion of Christ to the screen in a silent-era supreme spectacle. The opening and resurrection scenes shimmered with the glory of two-strip Technicolor‚Äî an early glimpse of cinematic divinity. 

PizzaFLIX is proud to present the synchronized sound version of 1928. While there is no spoken dialogue, this edition features special effects and the original orchestra score by Hugo Riesenfeld.

The awe-inspiring silent epic from legendary director Cecil B. DeMille brings the final weeks of Jesus Christ‚Äôs life to the screen with groundbreaking visuals and deeply human storytelling. Filmed with reverence and grandeur, the film features a powerful performance by H.B. Warner as Jesus, with Jacqueline Logan as Mary Magdalene, and Ernest Torrence as Peter.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

üçïSubscribe to PizzaFLIX for more timeless gems from the Golden Age of Hollywood! Don‚Äôt forget to like, comment, and share if you love vintage cinema.üçï

Known for its lavish production design and monumental set pieces, The King of Kings captivated audiences in the silent era and remains a significant cinematic achievement nearly a century later. It was a cornerstone of DeMille‚Äôs career, blending faith, artistry, and spectacle in a way rarely seen on screen at the time.

 #TheKingOfKings #CecilBDeMille #SilentFilm #ClassicCinema #BiblicalEpic #HBWarner #JacquelineLogan #ErnestTorrence #SilentMovie #FilmHistory#OldHollywood #ClassicMovieMonday #PizzaFLIX

metadata.Plot: Mary Magdalene becomes angry when Judas, now a follower of Jesus, won't come to her feast. She goes to see Jesus and becomes repentant. From there the Bible story unfolds through the Crucifixion and Resurrection.
metadata.Actors: H.B. Warner, Dorothy Cumming, Ernest Torrence
